alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern Passaic; Western Bergen; Western Essex; Western Union (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 8:08PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EASTERN PASSAIC...ESSEX AND NORTHWESTERN UNION COUNTIES THROUGH 900 PM EDT... At 807 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Green Pond to Victory Gardens to Chester. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Wayne and Fairfield around 830 PM EDT. Caldwell around 835 PM EDT. Paterson and Hawthorne around 840 PM EDT. Passaic, Bloomfield and Orange around 845 PM EDT. Paramus and Summit around 850 PM EDT. Millburn around 855 PM EDT. Other locations that could be impacted by these storms include Montclair, Cedar Grove, Glen Ridge, Totowa, Maplewood, Nutley, Glen Rock, Haledon, North Haledon and Prospect Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Eastern Passaic; Western Bergen; Western Essex; Western Union
